HetNet Gateway

The HetNet Gateway (HNG) is used to virtualize and aggregate multiple technology Radio Access Network (RAN) interfaces to manage GSM (2G), UMTS (3G), and LTE (4G) cells.

The HNG is situated between Radio Access Network (RAN) and Core network and uses standard backhaul capabilities. It reduces network complexity by abstracting different RANs, and by abstracting changes from the Core network to the RAN and from the the RAN to the core network. For example, the HNG can virtualize thousands of base stations to look like a few virtualized super cells (boomer cell) to the core service provider network.

The HNG has the following capabilities that are supported across the network:

  • Acts as a RAN controller that can aggregate all RAN interfaces.
  • Provides X2 gateway functionality for interference mitigation and inter-RAN mobility.
  • Supports an LTE small cell gateway (base station), which is comprised of the Home eNodeB (HeNBGW), Home Node B Gateway (HNB GW), and virtual Radio Network Controller (RNC), and the LTE security gateway that is to set up an IPsec tunnel with the eNodeB to encrypt all traffic between the eNodeBs.
  • Supports Multiple Operator Core Network (MOCN) for sharing the access network (NodeB, eNodeB) between two or more network operators.
  • Complies with ETSI network functions virtualization (NFV) for Virtual Network Funtions (NFV).
  • Allows multiple vendors on the RAN and multi-technologies to be used.
  • Reduces overall network signaling towards the Core network.
  • Aggregates interfaces towards core network.
  • Configure System HNG and NETCONF Settings
    Use this task to configure HetNet Gateway (HNG) and Network Configuration Protocol (NETCONF) system settings on the PW EMS so that the PW EMS and HNG can communicate in order to pass configurations between them. The NETCONF protocol provides mechanisms to install, manipulate, and delete the configuration of network devices.
  • Start the HNG to Activate the VeNB Configuration
    Once the HNG configuration is added to the PW EMS, the HNG must be started or a switchover must be performed if it is operational already.
